page.title: 13Sulgrave Mills
page.content: In the fields to the north of the village are the remains of two mills. The windmill ceased to function in 1915 and has now been rebuilt as a family home. The watermill ceased to operate in 1919 and is now part of a private house.The mill itself is derelict and needs to be renovated if it is to be saved for the future.The water was provided by a large mill pond fed by two springs,one of which was said to have medicinal properties. This year the mill pond and a stone barn have been sold for conversion into a dwelling house for $66,000.The mill house,called Mill Hollow has just been sold by auction for $80.000. The mill ponds are a haven for wild life and are regularly visited by Beswick and Whooper swans.
